member.summary: Defines it the central curve is defined by a radius.

member.summary: Defines if the central curve is defined by a degree of curve.

member.summary: Loads and makes the form visible

member.name: M:SpiralTools.SCS_tool.OnMouseDown(ESRI.ArcGIS.Desktop.AddIns.Tool.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: On the MouseDown Event this sub routine checks to see if the user is looking for a point required to construct the spiral curve spiral construction. If it is, gets the map coordinates and assigns it to the parnter form window text boxes related to the points.
member.remarks: This also enables the snap graphic Refer to the OnMouseMove override

member.name: M:SpiralTools.SCS_tool.OnMouseMove(ESRI.ArcGIS.Desktop.AddIns.Tool.MouseEventArgs)
member.summary: Checks to see if _IsCircleActive. The circle is used to verify if the cursor is snapping to a snap feature.

member.summary: shows the Dockable Window

member.name: M:SpiralTools.SCS_tool.OnDeactivate
member.summary: When tool is deactivated it removes snap graphic if visible

member.name: M:SpiralTools.SCS_tool.OnUpdate
member.summary: Enables the tool when the edit session is started. It also hides the SCSDockwindow when the edit session is ended. if the snapping marker is visible at the stop editing event, it is deleted.

member.name: T:SpiralTools.SCS_tool
member.summary: Provides an ArcMap Command with functionality to Construct a Spiral-Curve-Spiral transition feature. These features are common in Highways and freeways.

member.summary: Checks the editing State

member.name: M:SpiralTools.SpiralUtilities.ConstructSCSbyLength(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IPoint,System.Double,System.Double,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs to spiral curve sprial transition
member.param: As an IPoint. The beginning point of the spiral-curve-spiral construction
As an IPoint. The tangent point, or Point of Intersect of the tangents for the spiral-curve-spiral construction
As an IPoint. The end point of the spiral-curve-spiral transition
As double, the radius of the central spiral
as boolena, is curve counter clockwise
